serverProxy

Interface ServerProxy

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MockProxy, RealProxy

    public interface ServerProxy
    The server interface that will be implemented by the real and mock server proxies
    Version:
    1.0 Build Winter 2016.
    Author:
    Christian Riboldi, Clayton Condie, Jacob Brewer, Joshua Powers, Joshua Van Steeter

    • Method Detail

      • userLogin

        boolean userLogin(java.lang.String username,
                java.lang.String password)
        Validates the player's credentials, and logs them in to the server (i.e., sets their catan.user HTTP cookie)
        Parameters:
        username - Catan account username
        password - Catan account password
        Returns:
        True if login was successful or false if an error occcurred.

      • userRegister

        boolean userRegister(java.lang.String username,
                   java.lang.String password)
        Creates a new player account, and logs them in to the server (i.e., sets their catan.user HTTP cookie)
        Parameters:
        username - Catan account username
        password - Catan account password
        Returns:
        True if registration was successful or false if an error occurred.

      • listGames

        java.util.List<CommGame> listGames()
        Get a list of all games in progress.
        Returns:
        a list of game communication objects of available games

      • createGame

        CommGame createGame(boolean randomTiles,
                  boolean randomNumbers,
                  boolean randomPorts,
                  java.lang.String name)
        Creates a new game.
        Parameters:
        randomTiles - Whether the tiles should be randomly placed.
        randomNumbers - Whether the numbers should be randomly placed.
        randomPorts - Whether the ports should be randomly placed.
        name - The name of the game.
        Returns:
        A game communication object of the newly created game.

      • joinGame

        boolean joinGame(int gameId,
               CatanColor color)
        Adds (or re-adds) the player to the specified game, and sets their catan.game HTTP cookie
        Parameters:
        gameId - The ID of the game to join.
        color - ['red' or 'green' or 'blue' or 'yellow' or 'puce' or 'brown' or 'white' or 'purple' or 'orange']: What color you want to join (or rejoin) as.
        Returns:
        True if joining the game was successful, false if an error occurred.

      • saveGame

        boolean saveGame(int gameId,
               java.lang.String fileName)
        Saves the current state of the specified game to a file. This method is for testing and debugging purposes. When a bug is found, you can use the /games/save method to save the state of the game to a file, and attach the file to a bug report. A developer can later restore the state of the game when the bug occurred by loading the previously saved file using the /games/load method. Game files are saved to and loaded from the server's saves/ directory.
        Parameters:
        gameId - The ID of the game to save.
        fileName - The file name you want to save it under.
        Returns:
        True if save is successful, false if an error occurred.

      • loadGame

        boolean loadGame(java.lang.String fileName)
        Loads a previously saved game file to restore the state of a game. This method is for testing and debugging purposes. When a bug is found, you can use the /games/save method to save the state of the game to a file, and attach the file to a bug report. A developer can later restore the state of the game when the bug occurred by loading the previously saved file using the /games/load method. Game files are saved to and loaded from the server's saves/ directory.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of the saved game file that you want to load. (The game's ID is restored as well.)
        Returns:
        True if load is successful, false if an error occurred.

      • getGameModel

        GameModelJSON getGameModel(int modelNumber)
        Returns the current state of the game in JSON format. You must login and join a game before calling this method.
        Parameters:
        modelNumber - The version number of the model that the caller already has. It goes up by one for each command that is applied. If you send this parameter, you will get a model back only if the current model is newer than the specified version number. Otherwise, it returns the string "true" to notify the caller that it already has the current model state.
        Returns:
        The current state of the game in a game model JSON object

      • resetGame

        GameModelJSON resetGame()
        Clears out the command history of the current game For the default games created by the server, this method reverts the game to the state immediately after the initial placement round. For user-created games, this method reverts the game to the very beginning (i.e., before the initial placement round). This method returns the client model JSON for the game after it has been reset. You must login and join a game before calling this method.
        Returns:
        The 'Client Model' JSON (identical to getGameModel())

      • setCommands

        GameModelJSON setCommands(java.util.List<Command> commands)
        Executes the specified command list in the current game. This method can be used for testing and debugging. Typically, the command list passed in was previously obtained by calling the /game/command (GET) method. This method returns the client model JSON for the game after the command list has been applied. You must login and join a game before calling this method.
        Parameters:
        commands - The list of commands to be executed
        Returns:
        The 'Client Model' JSON (identical to getGameModel())

      • getCommands

        java.util.List<Command> getCommands()
        Returns a list of commands that have been executed in the current game. This method can be used for testing and debugging. The command list returned by this method can be passed to the /game/command (POST) method. For the default games created by the server, this method returns a list of all commands that have been executed after the initial placement round. For user-created games, this method returns a list of all commands that have been executed in the game since the very beginning (i.e., before the initial placement round). You must login and join a game before calling this method.
        Returns:
        Returns the list of Commands that have occurred since the game was initialized

      • addAI

        boolean addAI(java.lang.String AIType)
        Adds an AI player to the current game. You must login and join a game before calling this method.
        Parameters:
        AIType - The type of AI player to add (currently, LARGEST_ARMY is the only supported type). Only strings returned by /game/listAI are valid.
        Returns:
        True if method was successful, false if an error occured.

      • listAI

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> listAI()
        Returns a list of supported AI player types (currently, LARGEST_ARMY is the only supported type).
        Returns:
        A list of support AI player types

      • sendChat

        GameModelJSON sendChat(int playerIndex,
                     java.lang.String content)
        Sends a chat message.
        Parameters:
        playerIndex - Who's sending this chat message.
        content - The message to be posted
        Returns:
        The 'Client Model' JSON (identical to getGameModel())

      • rollNumber

        GameModelJSON rollNumber(int playerIndex,
                       int number)
        Parameters:
        playerIndex - Who's sending this command (0-3).
        number - What number was rolled (2-12).
        Returns:
        The 'Client Model' JSON (identical to getGameModel()))

                      int victimIndex,
                      HexLocation hexLocation)
        Parameters:
        playerIndex - Who's doing the robbing
        victimIndex - The order index of the player to rob.
        hexLocation - The new HexLocation of the robber
        Returns:
        The 'Client Model' JSON (identical to getGameModel())

      • soldier

                    int victimIndex,

        victimIndex - The index of the player to rob.
        hexLocation - The new HexLocation of the robber

                     ResourceType resource)
        Plays a 'Monopoly' card from your hand to monopolize the specified ResourceType.
        Parameters:
        playerIndex - Who's playing this dev card
        resource - The ResourceType that all players must give to the player who played the dev card
        Returns:
        The 'Client Model' JSON (identical to getGameModel())

      • buildRoad

        GameModelJSON buildRoad(int playerIndex,
                      EdgeLocation roadLocation,
                      boolean free)
        Builds a road at the specified HexLocation. (Set 'free' to true during initial setup.)
        Parameters:
        playerIndex - Who's placing the road
        roadLocation - Where the road will be placed
        free - Whether this is placed for free (setup).
        Returns:
        The 'Client Model' JSON (identical to getGameModel())

      • buildSettlement

        GameModelJSON buildSettlement(int playerIndex,
                            VertexLocation vertexLocation,
                            boolean free)
        Builds a settlement at the specified HexLocation. (Set 'free' to true during initial setup.)
        Parameters:
        playerIndex - Who's placing the settlement
        vertexLocation - Where the settlement will be placed.
        free - Whether this is placed for free (setup).
        Returns:
        The 'Client Model' JSON (identical to getGameModel())

      • offerTrade

        GameModelJSON offerTrade(int playerIndex,
                       int receiver,
                       java.util.List<ResourceType> offer)
        Offers a domestic trade to another player.
        Parameters:

        receiver - Who you're offering the trade to
        offer - What you get(+) and what you give (-)
        Returns:
        The 'Client Model' JSON (identical to getGameModel())

      • acceptTrade

        GameModelJSON acceptTrade(int playerIndex,
                        boolean willAccept)
        Used to accept or reject a trade offered to you.
        Parameters:
        playerIndex - Who's accepting/rejecting this trade.
        willAccept - Whether you accept the trade or not.
        Returns:
        The 'Client Model' JSON (identical to getGameModel())

      • maritimeTrade

        GameModelJSON maritimeTrade(int playerIndex,
                          int ratio,
                          ResourceType input,
                          ResourceType output)
        Used to execute a maritime trade.
        Parameters:
        playerIndex - Who's doing the trading
        ratio - The ratio of the trade you're doing as an integer
        input - What type of ResourceType you're giving
        output - What type of ResourceType you're receiving
        Returns:
        The 'Client Model' JSON (identical to getGameModel())

      • discardCards

        GameModelJSON discardCards(int playerIndex,
                         java.util.List<ResourceType> discardedCards)
        Discards the specified ResourceType cards.
        Parameters:
        playerIndex - Who's discarding
        discardedCards - List of ResourceTypes being discarded
        Returns:
        The 'Client Model' JSON (identical to getGameModel())

      • changeLogLevel

        boolean changeLogLevel(LogLevel logLevel)
        Sets the server's log level. (ALL, SEVERE, WARNING ,INFO, CONFIG, FINE, FINER, FINEST, OFF)
        Parameters:
        logLevel - The level you want the server to log at
        Returns:
        True if the change was successful, false if an error occurred.
